gameLogic
Class Session

java.lang.Object
  gameLogic.Session

public class Session
extends java.lang.Object

Represents the internal structure of a game session. Takes care of things such as snake movement, collision detection and victory conditions. Participants don't need to care about Session; it is documented for satisfying curiosity only.

Author:
Sixten Hilborn, Arian Jafari

prepareForStart

public void prepareForStart()

hasEnded

public boolean hasEnded()
Checks whether the game has ended or not. If only one snake remains alive (and the game was started using more than one snake), or if a snake has achieved the minimum requireds score in order to win the game, this method returns true.

Returns:
true if the game has ended, false if not.

getGameResult

public GameResult getGameResult()
Returns a GameResult object constructed using the current real-time results. Note that this method does not guarantee that the game has ended. Check using hasEnded() first before assuming that this will return a final gameResult.

Returns:
The current result of this session.

tick

public void tick()
Moves all the snakes simultaneously, checks for collision, kills colliding snakes, adds point when fruit is eaten, and updates the gamestate.
